Have just completed first mission, no glitches, crashes or problems of any kind. Excellant game

Have you been looking for a new real time strategy game lately to scratch that strategy itch you've been having? Well look elsewhere, because Citadels is a dreadful and incomplete mess. The game was created by an unknown and inexperienced development studio called Games Distillery. Currently a different studio called Big Moon was hired to add further playability and stability to the game. In the future, at best you can only hope for a polished yet dreadful entertainment product (without the entertainment value).   Citadels attempts to accomplish what so many other strategy games have already done before, and it accomplishes those things poorly. Citadels most closely resembles a stripped down Age of Empires title. Everything from base building, combat, and resource gathering are implemented poorly. There is no strategy involved at all because combat boils down to spamming units. You can literally spam the most basic miliary unit available and win every time. The utter lack of military units available leaves no room for strategy, tactics, or planning at all.   The game has a boring campaign that currently can't even be finished entirely, and a few lacklusted skirmish modes with terrible AI. There is only one map available per skirmish mode and no matter the difficulty you choose you cannot lose due to the incompetent AI. Citadels is only a singleplayer game so these are your only options. There is no map or scenario editor or multiplayer of any kind. The poor quality of this title combined with the utterlack of content at a $40 price point is downright theivery. Avoid at all costs.  I only put 3 hours into this game but that was rather generous of me. The boring gameplay, poor design, and lack of content leave little reason for me to play any further.

So this game had the potential to be great, but everything they tried to do was simply implemented horribly. I tried to see the positives in this game to no avail. My rant/review shall now commence.  You'd imagine that the wall and citadel construction would have been done right since it's the bloody title of the game.. well guess again, it's horrendous and inexplicably complicated and bugy. (also for some reason, the further away you place your wall, the less fps you have, I don't understand how that could be an actual correlation in this day and age)  Another thing is the menus and extremely unfriendly interface. There are many icons which supposedly show different resources.. the only thing is they're basically all the same. Adding to the horrible interface is the crappy layout of buildings and options. There's just a bunch of fancy pop-out menus with NOTHING in them. You will literally see a huge menu with only one option and no tooltips or anything. Oh and remember all those lovely hotkeys that every relatively new rts has? That's right you guessed it, this game has none.  As I'm sure you've noticed, this is quite an angry review and has turned into a rant rather than an objective review. BUT, after having played a few skirmishes against the so called 'a.i.' I felt compelled to try and save you from the dreadful experience that lies ahead.  I somehow managed to get it for 6 euros and I still feel cheated. This game is so pre-alpha that no one should ever be able to buy it until they at least remove all the bugs and arrange the ai and interface.  Save yourself and your wallet, do not waste money on this.  DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.  I'm out.
Abandon-ware at it's worst. Do not waste your money on this unfinished, unpatched mess.

Don't get me wrong, I think it's a beautiful game with much potential in it but at the current point(09.08.15) it just unplayable. I needed five attempts to fully finish one round because the game always crashed. And there is no autosave actually so always manually saving. The possibility shown in the trailer where the fortress-walls are build in and onto the concrete stone is just not existing, what actually is very annoying because your building units stuck from time to time behind the fortress wall they are building and u have no other choice as to keep them there or deconstruct the whole wall. What also leads to the next problem the unit limit that is caped at 99 units. I understand that units are objects and they take space in your RAM so they can't just put 9k unit-limit but 99 looks so small and unimportant in a actual battle that I got just bored after the first round. And that are just a few of the bugs I experienced in just 3h of play. So as for me I will stop playing the game right now and maybe I will retry it in about a year again what I would suggest also for you guys. If a dev reads this keep doin but be faster. And as said... Much potential but so far not worth its money and I just payed 5 Euro...

Not worth the $10. Look I like me some RTS and usually have a fair amount of leancy on games. This one though just made me mad. The controls are bad. So bad. Its a perspective problem. So when you scroll out to see the whole map the devs didn't compensate for this and you have to move you curser behind what you want to select. Thats ok till you start trying to click the small people on a large map, forget it.  I honestly just got past the first level and wanted to never play it again. I'm not usually so annoied by poorly made games, I think its the price tag that bothers me. There are many games that aren't as polished and they take that and compensate the price. This one jumps out at $40 and then makes you feel like your getting a steal at 75% off. No. This game should be a $19.99 game, or $5 on sale.
